author: smartprogrammer
content:
Proposing 7732 to be included in fusaka:
https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/9291

author: stefanbratanov
content: <@363800010518822915> interested at what stages does Prysm calls fCU in ePBS, or mostly the logic was kept untouched

author: terencechain
content:
For processing cosensus block is still the same. We call FCU on a new head. This is the same as before
For processing execution payload, we would call FCU + attribute for proposing next slot. This is newly added. 
I think we could get rid of the consensus block FCU and just always use to execution payload FCU but we didnt do that in the interest of time
cc <@755590043632140352> to fact check, he coded this part

author: potuz
content: We don't call FCU on the block most of the time

author: potuz
content: Because a new block most of the time will not change the head

author: stefanbratanov
content: Makes sense, thanks for the answer! Similar to my thinking
